stories.text:
How do you cross the bridge between Knowing and Practicing?

I know what I should do, but practicing is quite a different story.

I make plans and lists, but then I fail to take action.

When I find myself in a stressful situation, my anxiety takes over and I react angrily, instead of responding appropriately. In a nutshell, I have the “Nice Guy Syndrome” where I constantly fail to set and maintain proper healthy boundaries, and then with time I get tired of people overstepping their boundaries and I get self-righteous and I do act like an asshole.

And my subconscious justifies it by playing the victim’s card, because I failed to maintain healthy boundaries I am justified in being angry.

I know it stems from anxiety, but I do not want to use that as an excuse, I want to use this knowledge to improve and overcome my anxiety.

What I have done and tried so far:

- Therapy: I was in therapy for Severe Clinical Depression for over 2 years, after about 1 year I was diagnosed “Depression-Free”. Looking in retrospect I didn’t have Depression, it was just that my life sucked. And why did my life sucked? Because of all the reasons described above, at that time I was unaware and clueless of my MO.

- Meditation: I practiced Zen for about 5 years, for 5 years I medidated an average of 10 hours/week, plus other Zen practice.

- Blogging and other forms of writings.

- I have read so many books: Feeling Good (David Burns), nost of the REBT books (Albert Ellis), and many more.

I have come a long way, but I also have a long way to go.

What I am looking for:

- Honest feedback

- Actionable feedback

- Practice(s) that I can start

Thanks in advance
stories.title: How do you cross the bridge between Knowing and Practicing?
